quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <canvas> Element[/h1]

The HTML canvas is used to draw graphics that include everything from simple lines to complex graphic objects.

The <canvas> element is defined by: [code format="html" ][b]<canvas [/b]id="canvas1" width="200" height="100">
<[b]/canvas[/b]>[/code]
[note]The <canvas> element is only a container for graphics. You must use a script to actually draw the graphics (usually JavaScript).[/note]
The <canvas> element must have an [b]id attribute [/b]so it can be referred to by JavaScript: [code format="html" ]<html>
   <head></head>
   <body>
     [b]<canvas id[/b]="canvas1" 
   width="400" height="300">[b]</canvas> 
[/b]
   <script>
      var can = document.getElementById("canvas1"); 
      var ctx = can.getContext("2d");
   </script>

   </body>
</html>[/code]
[b]getContext()[/b] returns a drawing context on the canvas.
[note]Basic knowledge of JavaScript is required to understand and use the Canvas.[/note]

quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Canvas Coordinates[/h1]

The HTML canvas is a two-dimensional grid.
The upper-left corner of the canvas has the coordinates (0,0).

X coordinate increases to the right.
Y coordinate increases toward the bottom of the canvas. [img id="2556" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: fillRect (36,10,22,12) indicates a rectangle with a height of...
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Drawing Shapes[/h1]

The[b] fillRect(x, y, w, h)[/b] method draws a "filled" rectangle, in which w indicates width and h indicates height. The default fill color is black. 

A black 100*100 pixel rectangle is drawn on the canvas at the position (20, 20): [code format="raw" codeId="58"]var c=document.getElementById("canvas1");
var ctx=c.getContext("2d");
ctx.[b]fillRect[/b](20,20,100,100);[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2557" width="100%"]
The [b]fillStyle [/b]property is used to set a color, gradient, or pattern to fill the drawing.
Using this property allows you to draw a green-filled rectangle. [code format="raw" codeId="59"]var canvas=document.getElementById("canvas1");
var ctx=canvas.getContext("2d");
ctx.fillStyle ="rgba(0, 200, 0, 1)";
ctx.fillRect (36, 10, 22, 22);[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2558" width="100%"]
The canvas supports various other methods for drawing:

[u][b]Draw a Line[/b][/u]
moveTo(x,y): Defines the starting point of the line.
lineTo(x,y): Defines the ending point of the line.

[b][u]Draw a Circle[/u][/b]
beginPath(): Starts the drawing.
arc(x,y,r,start,stop): Sets the parameters of the circle.
stroke(): Ends the drawing.

[b][u]Gradients[/u][/b]
createLinearGradient(x,y,x1,y1): Creates a linear gradient.
createRadialGradient(x,y,r,x1,y1,r1): Creates a radial/circular gradient.

[b][u]Drawing Text on the Canvas[/u][/b]
Font: Defines the font properties for the text.
fillText(text,x,y): Draws "filled" text on the canvas.
strokeText(text,x,y): Draws text on the canvas (no fill).
[note]There are many other methods aimed at helping to draw shapes and images on the canvas.[/note]
